did.unittitle: Preliminary Guide to the Washington State University Engineering Extension Budget and Data Files
did.abstract: Budget and Data files from the Engineering Extension from 1986.

bioghist.p: The departments which became the College of Engineering at Washington State University were in place when the school opened in 1892, with the first graduates in 1897. In 1946, a reorganization established the Washington State Institute of Technology as the entity which included the academic departments as the College of Engineering, the School of Mines, the Division of Industrial Research and the Division of Industrial Service. The Instutute was again reorganized in July 1966 into a College of Engineering with academic departments, a Research Division and a Technical Extension Service.In June of 1969 the Mining Engineering Department was absorbed into the Materials Science and Engineering Department. The Office of the Dean in 1981 consisted of the Dean of Engineering who oversaw all the College activities, the Associate Dean for Research and Graduate Studies, Associate Dean for Instruction, Assistant Dean for Facilities and Planning, and Assistant Dean for Extension.

scopecontent.p: This collection consists of budgets reports from fall, spring, and summer semesters. Budget and data reports are also included within this collection.

arrangement.p: This is an unprocessed collection. Any arrangement reflects either a pre-existing order from the records' creators or previous custodians, or preliminary sorting performed by staff.

Box 1 contains mostly files related to the Particleboard Proceedings, but also includes meeting minutes, correspondence, and programmatic material related to other conferences. Box 2 contains budget statements and reports.

accessrestrict.p: This collection is open and available for research use.

prefercite.p: Preliminary Guide to the Washington State University Engineering Extension Budget and Data Files, 1986 (UA1987-03)
Manuscripts, Archives, and Special Collections, Washington State University Libraries, Pullman, WA.

acqinfo.p: This material was transferred to WSU Libraries' MASC by Mary Jane Levi of the Centennial Oral History Project on January 20, 1987 and retained as UA1987-03.

controlaccess.p: This collection is indexed under the following headings in the online catalog. Researchers desiring materials about related topics, persons, or places should search the catalog using these headings.
